metadata.Title: CVE-2021-36160 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A carefully crafted request uri-path can cause mod_proxy_uwsgi to read above the allocated memory and crash (DoS). This issue affects Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.30 to 2.4.48 (inclusive).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-36160` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
apache2-bin - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
apache2-data - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
apache2-utils - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5').
